title: Integrating Digital Storytelling and Block Play into Instructional Design to Promote Early Childhood Creativity and Learning Attitudes

context.prior_knowledge: Early childhood education theories, fundamental teaching methodologies, and basic digital tool proficiency
context.additional_context: Graduate-level social studies-integrated curriculum for pre-/in-service elementary teachers. Emphasizes practical instructional design competencies executable in limited tech environments (smartphone-centric)

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more instructional designs for enhancing young children's creativity that integrate digital storytelling and block play
Learners can develop and apply assessment tools for young children's learning attitudes based on the STEAM framework
Can implement at least two strategies for designing creative collaborative activities that consider gender differences

resources: Digital Storytelling Creation Apps (e.g., Canva, StoryJumper)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
